summary: This document is an email chain from July 22, 2019, concerning complaints and requests from Jeffrey Epstein's legal team regarding his conditions at the New York Metropolitan Correctional Center. The attorneys raise issues about bathroom access, promised phone calls, and the ability to eat meals during legal visits. The correspondence is forwarded to supervisory staff at the Bureau of Prisons for review.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's attorneys filed complaints about his treatment at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in July 2019, shortly before his death.
Specific complaints included restricted bathroom access during legal visits, failure to provide two promised social phone calls, and inability to eat proper meals while meeting with his legal team.
Epstein was reportedly eating snacks from vending machines instead of proper meals because he was not allowed to return to the attorney conference area if he left to eat.
The correspondence shows ongoing negotiations and conflicts between Epstein's defense team and prison officials regarding his conditions of confinement.
The document is marked 'CONFIDENTIAL' and is part of the SDNY (Southern District of New York) case files.
